result.execSummary:
The defendant Kraig T Hardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs and Surcharge to be paid within 9 months and/or 52 hours of Community Service.  Failure to pay or complete Community Service the court orders 5 days Huber as  Contempt.

TIME SERVED.
Jail (Straight Time).
Credit For Time Served 33 days.
DNA Sample ordered if not already provided.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
